page.title: 18SKERRIES WEATHER
page.content: Though the gales and storms are here in the winter the temperature is not usually below 0 degrees centigrade. There is not a lot of snow because the sea keeps the heat through the winter, but through the summer the sea makes us cool and its very rare to have a temperature of 20 degrees centigrade. When the wind is very strong there is no shelter against it, no trees no big hills. We measure the wind speed with an anemometer on top of our school and then we mark it on a graph. When the wind is right strong the waves come in over the rocks and cliffs. The air is full of spray and the waves can move big slabs of concrete and the water can go into the shop. When the wind drops the sea goes right calm and sometimes this brings fog.
